alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 31 at 12:52PM MST until July 31 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 1250 PM MST, a thunderstorm near the northern Chiricahua mountains was pushing a strong outflow northward toward I-10. Areas of blowing dust are possible between Willcox and the New Mexico border. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 344 and 391. Route 191 between mile markers 88 and 91. Locations impacted include... Bowie and San Simon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this dust channel. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
